definitions.definition: a number, especially one that forms part of official statistics or relates to the financial performance of a company.
a numerical symbol, especially any of the ten in Arabic notation.
one of a specified number of digits making up a larger number, used to give a rough idea of the order of magnitude.
examples: their market price runs into five figures

definitions.definition: an amount of money.
examples: a figure of two thousand dollars
synonyms: valuation "he can't put a figure on it"

definitions.definition: arithmetical calculations.
examples: she has no head for figures

definitions.definition: a person's bodily shape, especially that of a woman and when considered to be attractive.
examples: she had always been so proud of her figure

definitions.definition: a person seen indistinctly, especially at a distance.
examples: a backpacked figure appeared in the distance

definitions.definition: a person of a particular kind, especially one who is important or distinctive in some way.
examples: Williams became something of a cult figure

definitions.definition: a representation of a human or animal form in drawing or sculpture.

a shape defined by one or more lines in two dimensions (such as a circle or a triangle), or one or more surfaces in three dimensions (such as a sphere or a cuboid), either considered mathematically in geometry or used as a decorative design.
examples: a red ground with white and blue geometric figures

definitions.definition: a diagram or illustrative drawing, especially in a book or magazine.
a movement or series of movements following a prescribed pattern and often beginning and ending at the same point.
a pattern formed by the movements of a group of people, for example in square dancing or synchronized swimming, as part of a longer dance or display.
the external form or shape of a thing.
a short succession of notes producing a single impression.
the form of a syllogism, classified according to the position of the middle term.
be a significant and noticeable part of something.
examples: the issue of nuclear policy figured prominently in the talks
synonyms: crop up "a beast figuring in Egyptian legend"

definitions.definition: (of a person) play a significant role in a situation or event.
examples: he figured largely in opposition to the bill

definitions.definition: (of a fictional character) play a part in a novel, play, or movie.
examples: the four characters who figure in Ridley's play

definitions.definition: calculate or work out (an amount or value) arithmetically.
examples: calculate, work out, total, reckon, compute, determine, assess, put a figure on, crunch the numbers, tot up a way to figure the values

definitions.definition: think, consider, or expect to be the case.
examples: I figure that wearing a suit makes you look like a bank clerk
synonyms: guess "I figured that I didn't have a chance"

definitions.definition: (of a recent event or newly discovered fact) be logical and unsurprising.
represent (something) in a diagram or picture.
examples: varieties of this Cape genus are figured from drawings made there

definitions.definition: embellish (something) with a pattern.
examples: the floors were covered with figured linoleum
